headlines.description: — Andrew Benintendi had a season-high four RBI and finished a double shy of the cycle Wednesday, powering the Chicago White Sox to a 9-4 win over the New York Mets that prevented a three-game sweep.
headlines.shortLinkText: Benintendi's big day sends White Sox to 9-4 win over Mets

events.name: Chicago White Sox at New York Mets

headlines.description: — Angel Martínez hit a three-run, go-ahead homer and the Cleveland Guardians scored five times in the eighth inning to rally for a 7-4 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers on Wednesday.

headlines.description: — Caleb Durbin’s sacrifice fly drove in the winning run for the Milwaukee Brewers, who earned their first sweep of the season with a 6-5 victory over the Boston Red Sox in 10 innings on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Durbin's sacrifice fly gives the Brewers a 6-5 walk-off win over the Red Sox

headlines.description: — Agustín Ramírez had the first four-hit game of his career including a home run and a go-ahead two-run single as the Miami Marlins beat the San Diego Padres 10-8 on Wednesday.

headlines.description: — The second game of a three-game series between the Philadelphia Phillies and Atlanta Braves was postponed Wednesday because of rain and was rescheduled as part of a day-night doubleheader on Thursday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Phillies and Braves set for doubleheader after rainout. Harper gets extra day off after being hit

headlines.description: — Bo Bichette hit a pinch-hit, two-run homer in the ninth inning, five Toronto pitchers combined on a one-hitter and the Blue Jays beat the Texas Rangers 2-0 on Wednesday night.
